Key Match Events: Ghana and Sudan played a goalless draw in their 2025 Afcon qualifier match, with both teams collecting four yellow cards in total.
Pre-Game Insights: Ghana was under serious pressure to secure a win after drawing with Angola and Niger in their previous matches.
Post-Match Reflections: Ghana still remains third in Group F with two points after three matches, while Angola and Sudan lead the group with six and four points respectively.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was significant due to the fact that Ghana's coach, Otto Addo, had expressed his dislike for their opponent's coach, James Kwasi Appiah, who is a former Ghana national team coach.
Others: The match was played at a time when Ghana was under a temporary ban from hosting international games due to their pitches not meeting the required standards.
